Ph.D. positions available on applications of machine learning and artificial intelligence to the analysis of data
Ph.D. positions available on applications of machine learning and artificial intelligence to the analysis of data
Posted on
28 January 2023
The AI4Text group at the Institute for the Science and Technologies of Information from the Italian National Council of Research has a number of Ph.D. positions available on topics related to the application of machine learning to the analysis and management of textual information. Topics
of interest especially include:
learning to quantify (a.k.a. quantification, or supervised prevalence estimation)
technology-assisted review and its applications
authorship analysis (including authorship attribution, native language identification, and others)
cross-lingual and cross-modal classification
active learning for interactive classification
Successful candidates will attend the Ph.D. programme at the University of Pisa, and carry out their research at ISTI-CNR, also in Pisa, under the supervision of researchers from the AI4Text group.
Candidates must apply by February 1, 2023: see the
link
for details on the application procedure.
The fellowships funded by the AIMH group are the following:
ING_INFO03_E: Information Engineering.
Research project in: “Information Technology III” on the subject “Artificial intelligence applied to the analysis of multimedia or textual information” (3 fellowships): see
link
.
DN01_E: National Ph.D. programme in Artificial Intelligence for Society.
Research project in: “Artificial intelligence for the analysis of multimedia or textual data” (2 fellowships): see
link
.
INFO03_E: PhD programme in Computer Science.
Research project in: “Artificial intelligence for multimedia and text analysis” (1 fellowship); see
link
.

Ph.D. positions available on applications of machine learning and artificial intelligence to the analysis of data
Ph.D. positions available on applications of machine learning and artificial intelligence to the analysis of data
Posted on
28 January 2023
The AI4Text group at the Institute for the Science and Technologies of Information from the Italian National Council of Research has a number of Ph.D. positions available on topics related to the application of machine learning to the analysis and management of textual information. Topics
of interest especially include:
learning to quantify (a.k.a. quantification, or supervised prevalence estimation)
technology-assisted review and its applications
authorship analysis (including authorship attribution, native language identification, and others)
cross-lingual and cross-modal classification
active learning for interactive classification
Successful candidates will attend the Ph.D. programme at the University of Pisa, and carry out their research at ISTI-CNR, also in Pisa, under the supervision of researchers from the AI4Text group.
Candidates must apply by February 1, 2023: see the
link
for details on the application procedure.
The fellowships funded by the AIMH group are the following:
ING_INFO03_E: Information Engineering.
Research project in: “Information Technology III” on the subject “Artificial intelligence applied to the analysis of multimedia or textual information” (3 fellowships): see
link
.
DN01_E: National Ph.D. programme in Artificial Intelligence for Society.
Research project in: “Artificial intelligence for the analysis of multimedia or textual data” (2 fellowships): see
link
.
INFO03_E: PhD programme in Computer Science.
Research project in: “Artificial intelligence for multimedia and text analysis” (1 fellowship); see
link
.

Ph.D. Course Announcement – An Holomorphic Dynamics Course
Posted on
4 January 2023
We are pleased to announce the Ph.D. course in Holomorphic Dynamics, given by Giulio Tiozzo (University of Toronto), from 11th January until 23rd of February.
Lectures will be at the SNS with the following schedule:
Wed.  11-13; Aula Bianchi Scienze
Thurs. 11-12; Aula Mancini
A very rough outline of the course is below:
A crash course on the holomorphic dynamics of one variable. Fatou and Julia sets.
Classification of Fatou components.
External Rays and combinatorics of Mandelbrot set.
Entropy of quadratic polynomials and Hubbard’s trees.
Further information is available on the
course page
on the Indico platform.

Food

Cultural heritage sciences
The mountain

Opening of the Vinci 2024 Call for Italo-French Academic Collaboration
Posted on
19 January 2024
The Vinci 2024 Call is now open for online applications until 12:00 PM on February 9, 2024.
The Vinci Call aims to promote integration between
the university education systems in Italy and France
, contributing to the harmonization process of university education in Europe.
In this edition, the call is directed towards:
Funding for joint or double degrees at the second level: Master’s Degree (Chapter I)
Mobility grants for co-supervised doctoral theses (Chapter II)
Three-year doctoral scholarships in co-supervision / Contrats doctoraux pour thèses en cotutelle (Chapter III)
The complete text of the call and further details are available on
the official website
. For additional information or clarification, please contact the Secretariat of the Italo-French University in Turin:

Call for 2023-24 INdAM Scholarships for Abroad
Call for 2023-24 INdAM Scholarships for Abroad
Posted on
19 December 2023
The announcement for the 2023-2024 academic year for the competition for 45 monthly study grants abroad
has been published by INdAM.
Young researchers active in mathematical research, of Italian citizenship, who have obtained a Ph.D. or an equivalent degree from a foreign university no more than seven years before the deadline of the announcement, in mathematical disciplines, are eligible to participate. Applicants should propose a research program that requires a stay abroad.
The monthly grants are typically intended for a period ranging from one to three months, with an expected
gross amount of €3,000.00
per month.
A contribution, even partial, for travel expenses may be recognized. Applications must be submitted by December 28, 2023, through a specific electronic form available on
INdAM website
.

Fullbright Opportunities 2024-25
Fullbright Opportunities 2024-25
Posted on
6 November 2023
We are pleased to highlight the following opportunities offered by the Fullbright Commission for the academic year 2024-25:
Fullbright Specialist Opportunity:
You can request the collaboration of U.S. faculty members who are part of the Fullbright Specialist roster for periods of 2-6 weeks, engaging in teaching and consultancy activities. The deadline for applications is December 15, 2023. For more information, visit
this page
.
Fullbright Intercountry Opportunity:
If you are interested in hosting U.S. Fullbright faculty and researchers in Italy and Europe for the academic year 2023-24 to conduct lectures, seminars, and participate in conferences, this opportunity has no specific deadline. Find out more on
this page
.
SUSI Competition (Study of the US Institutes for Student Leaders):
Open to undergraduate students in their first or second year (Italian citizens or with residency permits), this program focuses on Civic Engagement at the Michigan State University. It offers a summer opportunity (5 weeks between June and August) with full expenses covered by the Department of State. The application deadline is November 19. Learn more on
this page
.
Additionally, there are ongoing competitions for study, research, and teaching for the academic year 2024-25. You can find all the information on
this page
.
For further information, please feel free to contact the Fullbright Commission directly at the following email address:
info@fulbright.it
.

Erasmus+ STA Teaching Staff Mobility 2023-24
Erasmus+ STA Teaching Staff Mobility 2023-24
Posted on
23 October 2023
The University has announced the availability of funds for the academic year 2023/2024 to support the mobility of teaching staff (STA) within the framework of Erasmus+.
The University sponsors mobility for a maximum of 7 days in total (5 days for maximum activities + 2 days for maximum travel), or in the case of “green” travel (bicycle/bus/car-pooling/train), up to a maximum of 9 days in total (5 days for maximum activities + 4 days for maximum travel).
Interested faculty members are kindly requested to express their interest by sending an email to
international@dm.unipi.it
, including the following information:
First and last name;
Destination (full name of the partner University and Erasmus code);
Mode of transportation to be used;
Number of days, including travel;
Period (please specify at least the month in which the departure is expected).
Priority will be given to those who have not previously utilized this opportunity

Posted on
12 September 2023
Registrations are now open for the charitable event “Corri la Vita,” which will take place in Florence on September 24th. This year, Erasmus+ Indire will participate in the race in solidarity with an important cause.
The Erasmus+ Indire Agency is forming a team composed of students, teachers, and other members of the Erasmus+ program to participate in the event, and there’s also an “Erasmus Prize” up for grabs for the team’s top runner.
It’s a unique opportunity to combine sports and European education, and the Agency’s information point will be open during the event for those who want to learn more about Erasmus+ opportunities.

here

Posted on

These mobilities, which must be completed by July 31, 2023, involve a minimum of 5 working days for teaching or training at partner universities within the project. These days are covered by a grant that includes travel and accommodation expenses, administered according to the University’s regulations.

Galileo 2024 Call: Funding Opportunities for Italy-France Research Projects
Galileo 2024 Call: Funding Opportunities for Italy-France Research Projects
Posted on
23 March 2023
The Galileo Program has opened applications for its 2024 Call, offering funding for collaborative research projects between Italy and France. This initiative aims to support projects that will take place from 2024 to 2025, promoting collaboration among researchers from both countries. The thematic areas covered include mathematical sciences, cultural innovations, quantum technologies, climate challenges, technological impact, and common European values. The schedule includes online registration until May 19, 2023, with results announced in December 2023 and researcher mobility from 2024 to 2025.
For further details, you can visit the
University of Italy-France website
and the
following page
on the University’s website.

Call for 2023-24 INdAM Research Projects
Call for 2023-24 INdAM Research Projects
Posted on
14 December 2023
INdAM has announced a competition for the funding of 10 Research Projects. The funding aims to support and develop research in emerging areas of mathematical research and its applications and will be allocated across three distinct funding lines as follows:
Line 1 Starting Grants
4 projects with the main focus on one of the ERC subsectors in the PE1 area, each amounting to €30,000.00 reserved for researchers affiliated with the INdAM National Research Groups who, as of December 31, 2023, have obtained a Ph.D. or equivalent title or a degree from a foreign university comparable to a Ph.D. title within the last 7 years.
Line 2 Consolidator Grants
3 projects with the main focus on one of the ERC subsectors in the PE1 area, each amounting to €30,000.00 reserved for researchers affiliated with the INdAM National Research Groups who, as of December 31, 2023, have obtained a Ph.D. or equivalent title or a degree from a foreign university comparable to a Ph.D. title for at least 7 years and up to 12 years.
Line 3 Advanced Grants
3 projects with the main focus on one of the ERC subsectors in the PE1 area, each amounting to €30,000.00 reserved for researchers affiliated with the INdAM National Research Groups who, as of December 31, 2023, have obtained a Ph.D. or equivalent title or a degree from a foreign university comparable to a Ph.D. title for at least 12 years.
The funding will be used for missions, participation in and organization of scientific events, and collaborations with other researchers, including interdisciplinary collaborations.
The text of the call can be found on the Institute’s website at the
following page
, where you can also find the application form that must be submitted by
5:00 PM on January 25, 2024
.

Anna Baccaglini-Frank awarded the prestigious UMI-AIRDM “Giovanni Prodi” Prize
Anna Baccaglini-Frank awarded the prestigious UMI-AIRDM “Giovanni Prodi” Prize
Posted on
4 September 2023
Professor Anna Ethelwyn Baccaglini-Frank from the Department of Mathematics of the University of Pisa has been awarded the prestigious “Giovanni Prodi” prize for research in Mathematics Education conducted by researchers under the age of 40 who have made an original and significant international contribution.
The award, in its first edition and conferred every four years, was presented during the XXII Congress of the Italian Mathematical Union at the Teatro Verdi in Pisa.
The commission recognized the rigorous work of Professor Baccaglini-Frank and the importance of her research results at the global level. The winner expressed her gratitude for the recognition and emphasized the importance of the support she received from her colleagues and mentors in her research journey.
Additional information about the award can be found on the
dedicated page
.

Bruno Martelli awarded the “Frontiers of Science Awards”
Bruno Martelli awarded the “Frontiers of Science Awards”
Posted on
19 July 2023
We would like to announce that Bruno Martelli, along with Giovanni Italiano and Matteo Migliorini, two doctoral students supervised by him at the SNS, has received the “Frontiers of Science Awards” prize, which will be presented to him this week in Beijing.
The award is aimed at recognizing the best basic and applied research papers published in the last 5 years. Among the awarded authors, in addition to Martelli, Italiano, and Migliorini, are several Fields Medalists, including Akshay Venkatesh, Caucher Birkar, Maxim Kontsevich, Peter Scholze, Maryam Mirzakhani, Alessio Figalli, and Andrei Okounkov.

Posted on

The Department of Mathematics of the University of Pisa, within the “Department of Excellence” funding framework, launches a call for expression of interest to identify candidates at all levels with outstanding scientific expertise in the fields of
mathematics of machine learning and data science, high dimensional statistics;
mathematics and modeling of complex phenomena in physical and life sciences.
Interested candidates can write to
segamm@dm.unipi.it
, including a letter of motivation and a CV, with a description of current research and teaching activities
by Friday, March 31, 2023
.
All expressions will be kept strictly confidential. Knowledge of the Italian language is not required.
Tax benefits may apply according to Italian law for scholars that worked outside Italy for at least two years. The Department is committed to increasing diversity in research and welcomes applications from underrepresented groups.

On Wednesday, March 27, 19 professors from the University of Pisa, including Prof. Mario Salvetti and Prof. Giovanni Alberti from the Department of Mathematics, celebrated in the historic Aula Magna of Palazzo La Sapienza the conferral of the Ordine del Cherubino, an honor bestowed upon professors for their outstanding scientific merits or contributions to the life and functioning of the University.
The Department of Mathematics extends its sincerest congratulations to Prof. Salvetti and Prof. Alberti for the prestigious recognition bestowed upon them.

news on the University website

First FAIR Workshop on Human-Centered AI
Posted on
17 February 2024
The Department of Mathematics at the University of Pisa hosts the first FAIR workshop on Human-Centered Artificial Intelligence (AI), organized in collaboration with the FAIR – “Future AI Research” partnership and the Humane-AI network. The event, scheduled for February 19th and 20th, 2024, brings together researchers to discuss how AI can synergistically collaborate with humans, amplifying their capabilities without replacing them. The research aims to develop adaptive, collaborative, and responsible AI systems, considering social and ethical implications as well.
For more information, including links for online streaming, please visit the
following page
.

“Sguardi nel Futuro”: a complex transition
“Sguardi nel Futuro”: a complex transition
Posted on
23 October 2023
The University of Pisa is proud to present “Sguardi nel Futuro,” a series of events designed to connect young generations with experts from the fields of scientific research, industry, economics, and the social sciences. These gatherings will tackle critical topics to gain insight into what the future holds, including energy transition, climate change, life sciences, space exploration, artificial intelligence, global health, future jobs, informed citizenship, and geopolitical structures. Students in undergraduate, graduate, and integrated programs have the opportunity to participate in person at the first event, while anyone interested in following these meetings can do so via the provided
streaming link
. The inaugural session, led by Nicola Armaroli of CNR-ISOF, will focus on the intricate energy transition amidst a growing climate crisis and the technical and economic challenges it entails.
For more information and to access the full event schedule, please visit
the dedicated CIDIC page
.

Celebrating the Bicentenary of Enrico Betti’s Birth
Celebrating the Bicentenary of Enrico Betti’s Birth
Posted on
16 October 2023
The Department of Mathematics, in collaboration with the Scuola Normale and with the support of the Caript Foundation of Pistoia and Pescia, have organized a series of events to commemorate the bicentenary of the birth of Enrico Betti, the cornerstone of Pisan mathematical school.
On the upcoming
19th of October
, a conference titled “
Betti: Scientific and Civic Commitment
” will take place in Pistoia at the Caript Foundation. The following day, the
20th of October
, a conference entitled “
Betti’s Mathematical Work: Past and Present
” will be held in Pisa at the Carovana Palace.
Additionally, two exhibitions have been set up, one in Pistoia and another in Pisa, showcasing archival documents and illustrative material depicting Betti’s life and work.
For more information on the conferences and exhibitions, please visit
the following page
.

Job Meeting PISA
Posted on
22 November 2023
On
Wednesday, November 29
, with the sponsorship of the University of Pisa and the collaboration of the University’s Career Service, the new edition of
Job Meeting PISA
will take place.
Here is the schedule for the day, which will run from
9:30 to 16:30
in the spaces of Stazione Leopolda, in Piazza Guerrazzi:
– Orientation Workshop:
Creating an Effective CV
– Examples and templates. Joint construction of a promotional tool with a modern and personalized design.
– CV Check:
Professional advisors are available to provide personalized advice to make your resume more effective in reaching the desired role.
– IDEA STORM
: From 2:00 to 4:00 PM, you can put yourself to the test and engage with prestigious companies on innovation and technologies related to the current world of work. Alongside other participants with a passion for STEM subjects and guided by expert mentors, you will be inspired to generate new ideas. To participate in the challenges, registration for Job Meeting is required.
– Company Stands:
Recruiters are available to explain open positions and introduce opportunities aligned with your academic path.
– Company Presentations:
Participation in meetings with companies to discover their values and selection processes.
There are already thirty companies that you can meet:
view the complete list
To prepare effectively,
two online orientation webinars on job interviews and personal branding
are scheduled for the day before, featuring experts who will provide the best advice to make your profile and presentation stand out to selectors.
Participating in Job Meeting PISA is completely free:
simply register with a few clicks
and access all the opportunities and content offered.
For more information, you can email:
registrazioni@jobmeeting.it

Cubesat Milani: ready for launch in 2024
Cubesat Milani: ready for launch in 2024
Posted on
15 April 2024
The Milani cubesat, dedicated to the astronomer Andrea Milani Comparetti who passed away in 2018 and was a long-time professor at the Department of Mathematics of the University of Pisa, is ready for launch in October 2024 from the ESA Estec center in the Netherlands.
This nanosatellite will be part of the European Hera mission, aimed at studying the binary asteroid system of Didymos and Dimorphos, as well as evaluating the test of NASA’s kinetic impactor DART. The handover took place at Tyvak International in Turin, and subsequently the cubesat will be integrated and validated at the ESA Estec center before launch.
For more information, please visit the
following page
.
In the upcoming month of June, a conference will be held at the Department of Mathematics of the University of Pisa in honor of Andrea Milani and Paolo Farinella, titled “
Dynamics and physics in the solar system
”.

Prestigious appointment for Research – Professor Rita Pardini
Prestigious appointment for Research – Professor Rita Pardini
Posted on
10 April 2024
We are pleased to announce that Professor Rita Pardini from the Department of Mathematics has been awarded a prestigious appointment from the Knut and Alice Wallenberg Foundation.
As a Visiting Professor at Stockholm University, she will delve into algebraic geometry, focusing on the exploration of projective and quasi-projective varieties.
The Department of Mathematics extends its sincerest congratulations to Professor Pardini for this prestigious achievement.
For more information, please visit the
following page
.

Career Labs 2024
Career Labs 2024
Posted on
9 April 2024
From April 9th, the
Career Labs
of the University Career Service restart, interactive workshops aimed at helping students develop an entrepreneurial spirit and begin to design their professional future more effectively and consciously.
This year, the offer is structured in three cycles:
Self-empowerment to get to know yourself, reflect on difficulties and obstacles, and define goals
Effective communication to learn public speaking and manage interpersonal relationships
Personal branding to learn how to write a CV, create a profile on LinkedIn, and understand employment contracts
You can find all the details and the calendar with the dates of each workshop
at this link
.
The workshops are open to students and recent graduates of all courses and levels, and participation is simple and free: just sign up for the workshops of interest through the
Career Center portal
.

2024-25 Ph.D. courses
Click the button to discover the list of Ph.D. courses that will be taught during the academic year 2024-2025.
CHECK THE COURSES
A time-honoured tradition of excellence
The Ph.D. Programme in Mathematics at the University of Pisa has its roots in the time-honoured tradition of excellence of the mathematical school in Pisa.
FIND OUT MORE
Internationally recognised professors
Many of the professors of the Department of Mathematics are recognised internationally for their contributions to research and actively nurture a vast network of scientific relationships. Students can benefit from a considerable number of courses offered by the Ph.D. School, taught by professors of the Department, their collaborators of recognized international level, and external professors active in the territory on projects of applied mathematics.
CHECK THE FACULTY
Scientific research groups
Within the Department, there are several high-level scientific research groups: from those active in the most theoretical areas, such as Logic, Algebra, Geometry, and Analysis, to those more open to applications and/or interactions with companies and the territory, such as Probability, Mathematical Physics, Numerical Analysis, Mathematics Education, and History of Mathematics.
DISCOVER THE COURSES
DISCOVER THE RESEARCH GROUPS
A qualified preparation
in all areas of mathematics
The Ph.D. Programme in Mathematics aims to provide capable and motivated students with a qualified preparation, introducing them to research in all areas of mathematics, from the most theoretical to the most applied.
MEET THE STUDENTS
Department of Excellence
The strengthening of Ph.D. activities is a cornerstone objective of the Department of Excellence project, active at the Department of Mathematics of the University of Pisa between 2023 and 2027.
SEE THE PROJECT
Seminars, conferences
and summer schools
There is also an intense seminar activity and numerous conferences and summer schools organized at both the Department and the Scuola Normale Superiore, as well as at the Mathematical Research Center “E. De Giorgi”.
CHECK THE EVENTS
Scuola Normale Superiore
It is worth highlighting the close scientific connection with the Scuola Normale Superiore, one of the leading institutions for mathematics worldwide. Students can attend the advanced courses and the specialisation courses offered by the Scuola Normale Superiore.

Welcome to the homepage concerning the Research Activities carried out by the Department of Mathematics. The scientific groups of the Department focus on different aspects of Mathematical Logic, Algebra, Geometry, Mathematical Education and History of Mathematics, Mathematical Analysis, Probability and Statistics, Mathematical Physics, and Numerical Analysis.
Moreover, the Department of Mathematics hosts the
Research Unit
of the
Istituto Nazionale di Alta Matematica Francesco Severi
. The director of the Research Unit is
Ilaria Lucardesi
.
The website is divided into 4 sections:
The section
“Research Areas”
contains the pages of the different scientific groups active in the Department. Each page lists the research topics, the members, and the grants of the group.
The section
“Research Projects and Grants”
lists the projects and grants coordinated by the members of the Department.
The section “Activities” groups together seminars, conferences, and colloquia. The subsection
“Seminars”
contains the list of upcoming seminars and the pages of each Seminar Series managed by the scientific groups of the Department. The subsection
“Conferences”
lists the upcoming and past conferences organized by members of the Department.
The section
“News”
shows the latest news related to the research activities of the Department.

International
Agreements
Agreements
The Department of Mathematics has established
agreements with prestigious institutions inside and outside of Europe
, providing students with the opportunity to
spend time abroad, study, immerse themselves in different cultures, and engage with diverse educational systems.
The Department actively promotes international cooperation and mobility in
education
and
research
, participating in the Erasmus+ programme as well as forming bilateral inter-institutional agreements with universities worldwide.
See below for a list of all the agreements active at the Department of Mathematics.
Circle U.
The University of Pisa is also member of Circle U., a
European University Alliance
which includes 8 other prestigious European universities.
Since its launch in November 2020, the alliance partners have been cooperating with the goal of creating an
inclusive, interdisciplinary and strongly research-oriented European University
by 2025.
European Universities constitute true strategic partnerships which, in the aims of the European Commission, are called upon to build the universities of the future, promoting
European values and identity
and improving the quality and international competitiveness of higher education in Europe. The programme will initially focus on student-led
sustainable innovation, democracy, climate and global health
.
For further info please visit
the page on the University’s website
and
the Alliance’s website
.

Incoming
Incoming
The Department of Mathematics is committed to providing international students with a
rich and diverse range of opportunities in Pisa
through a variety of programmes. Whether you are a
student
looking to enhance your academic experience, a
faculty member
seeking teaching opportunities, or a
recent graduate
eager to explore the world, explore the resources on this page to learn more about
the various mobility options we offer
.
Mobility Programmes
Erasmus+
Erasmus+ is the EU’s funding programme to support
education, training, youth and sport in Europe
. The 2021-2027 programme places a strong focus on
social inclusion
, the
green and digital transitions
, and promoting
young people’s participation in democratic life
.
Erasmus+ supports
students and staff mobility
, and fosters
cooperation opportunities among Universities
across Europe.
The University of Pisa has an
Erasmus charter (2021-2027)
in place to participate in the Erasmus+ programme and accepts students as part of an organized study exchange with one of the University’s partner institutions or through an arranged traineeship.
Study
The
Erasmus+ Study programme
at the University of Pisa allows international students to
attend classes
at the Bachelor or Master’s level and
earn ECTS credits
. To apply for this opportunity, students need to ensure that their home institution has
a bilateral agreement with the Department of Mathematics
.
Here’s an outline of the process:
Nomination:
the home institution’s Erasmus coordinator nominates students by emailing the
Department International Office
;
Instructions:
After nomination, students will receive a confirmation message with application instructions;
Course Exploration:
Prior to applying, students should check
the list of available courses
and use
the VALUTAMI portal
to explore the courses in depth;
Application:
Students submit their application through
the Erasmus Mobility Portal
, following the current academic year’s deadlines and procedures;
Learning Agreement:
Students need to include a Learning Agreement Before the Mobility in their application, specifying the exams they intend to take at our Department and the corresponding recognized credits.
For additional details, please see the resources section at the bottom of the page or contact the
Department International Office
.
Traineeship
The
Erasmus+ Traineeship programme
at the University of Pisa offers students the opportunity to
gain credits for their traineeships
before or after graduation, provided their sending institution holds the Erasmus Charter for Higher Education.
To apply, students with Erasmus scholarships from their home universities should:
Contact a teacher
from the Department of Mathematics to discuss a traineeship project;
Register on the Alice portal
to obtain required credentials for enrollment at the University of Pisa;
Complete the
Learning Agreement Before the mobility
with project details and send it to
international@dm.unipi.it
;
Upon approval of the Learning Agreement by all parties, students must
apply through the
Erasmus Mobility Portal
;
After validation by the Erasmus Coordinator at the Department of Mathematics, the Central International Office at the University of Pisa will guide students through
the enrollment process
.
For further details, please contact the
Department International Office
.
Staff
The
Erasmus+ Staff programme
at the University of Pisa provides opportunities for
faculty
, including professors, researchers, and adjunct lecturers, and
administrative staff
to conduct
teaching assignments
or undertake
training periods
at the Department of Mathematics.
The
mobility duration
can range from a minimum of 2 consecutive working days to a maximum of 2 months. Before applying, interested members should ensure that their home institution has
a bilateral agreement with the Department of Mathematics
.
Funding is available
for eligible expenses.
For further details, please contact the
Department International Office
.
SEMP
Following the suspension of negotiations regarding Switzerland’s participation in the Erasmus+ programme, the Swiss Federal Council has introduced a temporary solution known as the
Swiss-European Mobility Programme
(SEMP).
SEMP allows
students, faculty, and administrative staff
from higher education institutions to undertake
mobility periods
for
studying
,
traineeships
,
teaching
, or
continuous training
. These mobility opportunities are available with
Swiss universities affiliated
and in agreement with the University of Pisa (please visit
the following page
for a list of Swiss universities partnered with Department of Mathematics).
The
Swiss National Agency funds the costs
for participants in mobility projects. Interested students should consult the
official SEMP Programme website
.
For further information, students can contact
the Coordinator for Internationalization
at the Department of Mathematics.
Visiting Fellow
The
Visiting Fellow programme
at the University of Pisa welcomes
scholars with strong academic backgrounds
to engage in
study
,
research
,
collaboration
, and
scientific exchange
. Visiting Fellows can stay for a period ranging from 1 to 12 months and are identified through an evaluation process, either through
application
or
invitation
.
Benefits:
Visiting Fellows receive a
dedicated workspace
,
internet access
, and a
university email
throughout their stay. The Department may also provide
travel
and
accommodation reimbursement
or a
flat fee
if teaching activities are involved. Research-focused Visiting Fellows may receive a co-financed flat fee from the proposing faculty member.
Activities:
Visiting Fellows conduct
individual study
,
research
, and
scientific collaboration
as agreed with the academic supervisor, culminating in a public seminar or lecture if not engaged in teaching.
Teaching:
Visiting Fellows may offer
certified educational activities
within various academic programs. Teaching arrangements depend on qualifications and must be approved by academic authorities and the Department Council.
Selection:
The selection process involves
application
or
invitation
by a faculty member.
For further information, please contact the  the
Coordinator of Internationalization
or visit
the following page on the University’s website
.
Visiting Student
The
Visiting Student programme
at the University of Pisa offers the opportunity for students from foreign universities to spend a
period of study
or an
internship
at our institution. This programme is open to those who
move independently
and do not have
a formal exchange agreement
with the Department of Mathematics.
The duration of the visit can range from a minimum of two weeks to a maximum of 12 months. Visiting Students are selected through
application
or by
faculty invitation
, subject to departmental approval.
Visiting Students have
access to the University facilities
and are covered by
insurance
and
safety measures
. They also receive temporary university email and network access.
Italian language courses
are available at a discounted rate.
For more information, please contact the
Coordinator of Internationalization
or visit
the following page on the University’s website
.
Summer/Winter School
Summer/Winter Schools
are
intensive educational programmes
designed for both Italian and international students. They typically feature
unconventional teaching methods
, such as workshops, tutorials, excursions, and cultural events, along with a
multidisciplinary approach
. The duration of the programmes varies from a minimum of 4 days to a maximum of 6 weeks, and the courses are conducted in the
English language
.
Details for applying, accomodation, and a full list of activated Schools can be found at
this page on the University’s website
.
Free Mover
Students from institutions without a specific agreement can apply for the
Free Mover programme
and earn
ECTS credits
.
The Free Mover programme is dedicated to students who are not participating in an organized exchange programme by a university, such as Erasmus. Instead, they
independently choose the host university
and
organize their own study abroad period
. Students are required to check with
the Coordinator for Internationalization
regarding the possibility of conducting a thesis preparation work as a Free Mover.
Full info on the programme can be found
at the following page on the University’s website
.
Resources
Guides

International Student Guide (PDF)
Meet Your Buddy (PDF)
University of Pisa (PDF)
Language Requirements
All
Bachelor courses
at the Department of Mathematics are held in
Italian
, whereas
Master courses
can be given in
English
, upon request. A
B1 level
in Italian (for Bachelor) or in English (for Master) is recommended, however
certifications
are not required.
The University of Pisa offers
Italian language courses
to international students. The courses are taught by the teachers of the CLI (
University Linguistic Center
). For more information please visit
the CLI website
.

Outgoing
The Department of Mathematics is committed to providing students with a
rich and diverse range of international opportunities
through a variety of mobility programmes. Whether you are a
student
looking to enhance your academic experience, a
faculty member
seeking international teaching opportunities, or a
recent graduate
eager to know the world, explore the resources on this page to learn more about
various mobility options
for
education
and
professional development
.
Mobility Programmes
Erasmus+
Erasmus+ is the European Union programme for
Education, Training, Youth, and Sport for 2021-2027
. It offers
Bachelor’s, Master’s and Ph.D. students
, as well as
recent graduates
and
faculty and administrative staff
members, the opportunity to undertake a
mobility period abroad
for a maximum of 12 months for each academic cycle.
Student mobility can be for study (minimum 2 and maximum 12 months) or traineeship (long-term mobility: minimum 2 and maximum 12 months; short-term mobility: minimum 5 days and maximum 30 days combined with a period of virtual mobility).
All relevant information about the Erasmus programme, including
application details
,
deadlines
, and
partner universities
, can be found on the University of Pisa’s
Erasmus Mobility portal
.
Study
The
Erasmus+ Study programme
allows students to
study abroad at partner institutions
(please visit
the following page
for a full list of the agreements) for a duration of
2 to 12 months at various academic levels
, including Bachelor’s, Master’s, and Ph.D.’s.
Students must indicate three preferred foreign destinations when applying, with consideration given to the alignment between the chosen destination and the student’s study plan. After application,
the Coordinator for Internationalization
will evaluate and publish the list of selected candidates. The complete information, including
specific deadlines and procedures
, can be found in
the annual Erasmus call
published by the University of Pisa. The application process typically occurs in
spring
, with a second round of applications opening in
September
for any remaining spots.
Students can find details on
application procedures
,
eligibility criteria
, and
selection criteria
on
the University’s Erasmus Mobility Portal
and on
the Erasmus+ website
.
Traineeship
The
Erasmus+ Traineeship
programme allows students to undertake
training activities
in participating Programme Countries and Partner Countries
in various organizations
, including businesses, public institutions, educational institutions, and more.
The duration of the traineeship can range from a
minimum of 2 months to a maximum of 12 months
. Students must find a host organization and obtain a
Traineeship Proposal Form
(TPF) signed by the host institution and the Department’s
Coordinator for Internationalization (CAI)
. The traineeship can also be pursued by recent graduates within 12 months of obtaining their degree.
Application details
,
required documents
, and
further information
are available on
the University’s Erasmus Mobility Portal
and on
the Erasmus+ website
.
Staff
The
Erasmus+ Staff
programme provides opportunities for University of Pisa
faculty
, including
professors, researchers, and adjunct lecturers
, to conduct teaching assignments in Programme Countries (KA103) and Partner Countries (KA107).
The mobility duration can range from a
minimum of 2 consecutive working days to a maximum of 2 months
, excluding travel days, with at least 8 hours of teaching per week for shorter stays. The selection process is based on bilateral agreements with institutions in participating countries (please visit
the following page
for a full list of the agreements), and applicants should apply through the Department’s
Coordinator for Internationalization (CAI)
. Funding is available for eligible expenses.
Additionally, there are opportunities for
administrative staff
to undertake training periods abroad and for faculty to teach at partner institutions with established agreements.
Further details
and
application information
can be found on
the University’s website
and on
the Erasmus+ website
.
SEMP
Following the suspension of negotiations regarding Switzerland’s participation in the Erasmus+ programme, the Swiss Federal Council has introduced a temporary solution known as the
Swiss-European Mobility Programme
(SEMP).
SEMP allows
students, faculty, and administrative staff
from higher education institutions to undertake
mobility periods for studying
,
traineeships
,
teaching
, or
continuous training
. These mobility opportunities are available at
Swiss universities
affiliated and in agreement with the University of Pisa (please visit
the following page
for a list of Swiss universities partnered with Department of Mathematics).
The
Swiss National Agency funds the costs
for participants in mobility projects. To apply for a mobility period at a Swiss university, interested students should consult the
official SEMP Programme website
and the website of the Swiss university they intend to apply to. It is important to note that selection for mobility to a Swiss institution grants the status of an Erasmus+ student but does not guarantee funding, as funding decisions are made by the Swiss university.
Applicants must adhere to
deadlines
and
documentation requirements
set by the host university, including any language proficiency certifications. Positive results achieved and agreed upon in the Learning Agreement are
fully recognized
upon completion of the mobility period.
For further information, students can visit the
related page on the University’s website
or contact
the Coordinator for Internationalization
at the Department of Mathematics.
Credits Abroad
The University of Pisa provides
mobility grants to Bachelor’s and Master’s degree students to earn credits abroad
. Students can select their destination countries, subject to approval through a Learning Agreement.
Eligibility criteria
and
application procedures
are outlined in the
selection notice on the University’s website
.
Thesis Abroad
The University of Pisa offers
mobility grants to graduating students
who wish to conduct part of their thesis research for at least two consecutive months at foreign institutions, organizations, companies, or international entities located abroad. Students can choose their destination countries, subject to approval through a Learning Agreement.
Details for applying
,
including eligibility criteria
,
duration
, and
funding information
, can be found in the
selection notice on the University’s website
.
Double Degree
Double Degree programmes are
collaborative educational initiatives with partner foreign universities
. They involve
curriculum integration
and
structured student mobility
, with mutual recognition of educational activities.
Upon completing such programmes, students are awarded not only the degree from their home university but also academic degrees from the participating foreign universities where they have earned academic credits. Alternatively, in the case of joint programs, students receive a single degree recognized and validated by all institutions that have jointly promoted the study programme.
For more information please visit
the following page
.
Summer School
For students looking to enhance their academic experience over the summer, it is possible to
gain credit recognition for courses taken at a partner university’s Summer School
. To do this, you should first reach out to the
International Office of the Department
and make the necessary arrangements.
You can find a list of
partner universities offering opportunities for summer schools
at this link
, while the full list of universities partnered with the Department of Mathematics can be accessed
at this page
.
SEND Mobility Consortium
The University of Pisa, in collaboration with the
SEND Mobility Consortium
, offers Erasmus+ scholarships for
student internships
and
staff training
as part of the “
Universities for EU Projects
” initiative.
The programme is open to undergraduates, master’s, doctoral, and postgraduate students, and supports internships lasting 60 to 90 days. Faculty and administrative staff can partake in mobility lasting 2 to 30. The aim is to develop skills related to
Social
,
Technological
, and
Economic Innovation
, contributing to
green and digital transitions
. Students can choose from host organizations in Erasmus+ member countries, such as the UK, Switzerland, and Turkey.
For more information about the Consorzio SEND, please visit
their website
.
Details for applying
,
including eligibility criteria
,
duration
, and
funding information
, can be found in the
selection notice on the University’s website
.
ISSNAF
The University of Pisa, in collaboration with the
Italian Scientists and Scholars in North America Foundation
(ISSNAF), offers scholarships for
study
and
research
periods in
North America
. These scholarships are available to students enrolled in a
Master’s
or
Ph.D.
programmme at the University of Pisa.
Successful candidates will have the opportunity to join research groups at
prestigious North American institutions
, subject to an assessment of the compatibility between the selected scholar’s profile, their research project, and the research activities of the host group.
For more information about the ISSNAF Foundation, please visit
their website
.
Details for applying
,
including eligibility criteria
,
duration
, and
funding information
, can be found in the
selection notice on the University’s website
.
Limoges
The University of Pisa has signed a convention with the
University of Limoges
for their
Master’s programme in Mathematics and Applications
, specifically the
ACSYON programme
(Algorithmique Calcul Symbolique et Optimisation Numérique). The purpose of the partnership is to
promote academic and scientific exchange
between the two universities. The convention specifies the
conditions for students
from the Department of Mathematics to access the first year of the ACSYON programme.
Please find below a summary of the main points of the convention:
Access to First Year:
students can apply for the first year of the ACSYON programme, which includes online courses in English;
Selection:
students will be selected jointly by the Coordinator for Internationalization at the Department of Mathematics of the University of Pisa and a professor from the University of Limoges responsible for ACSYON;
Exemption from Tuition Fees:
students accepted into the program will be exempt from tuition fees at the University of Limoges for the corresponding academic year;
Language of Instruction:
the courses will be delivered in English through online methods, with the University of Limoges responsible for course content, and the University of Pisa providing the necessary technical support;
Control of Knowledge:
students will take online assessments, exams, and assignments like other students from the University of Limoges, with the University of Pisa responsible for ensuring fair online exam procedures;
Certificate of Completion:
to earn a certificate of completion for the first year at the University of Limoges, students must complete 60 ECTS credits (including ACSYON courses);
Second Year Option:
students meeting the requirements are eligible to continue to the second year in Limoges, including an English-language semester and an internship.
Resources
Guides
Erasmus outgoing: Guida alla compilazione del Learning Agreement (YouTube video)
Useful Information for Mobility Periods (PDF)
Language Requirements
Students who plan to undertake a study mobility are advised to
check the language of instruction
for courses at the host university and the
minimum level of language proficiency
and/or
language certification
required for access to the courses. A student who needs to take foreign language courses can:
Before departure, refer to the
University Language Center
(CLI) to take language courses;
Upon arrival at the host university,
attend any language courses
provided for international students;
(Only for the Erasmus+ program) make use of the
Online Language Support platform
before and during the mobility.

Erasmus+ STA Teaching Staff Mobility 2023-24
Posted on
23 October 2023
The University has announced the availability of funds for the academic year 2023/2024 to support the mobility of teaching staff (STA) within the framework of Erasmus+.
The University sponsors mobility for a maximum of 7 days in total (5 days for maximum activities + 2 days for maximum travel), or in the case of “green” travel (bicycle/bus/car-pooling/train), up to a maximum of 9 days in total (5 days for maximum activities + 4 days for maximum travel).
Interested faculty members are kindly requested to express their interest by sending an email to
international@dm.unipi.it
, including the following information:
First and last name;
Destination (full name of the partner University and Erasmus code);
Mode of transportation to be used;
Number of days, including travel;
Period (please specify at least the month in which the departure is expected).
Priority will be given to those who have not previously utilized this opportunity

We are pleased to highlight the following opportunities offered by the Fullbright Commission for the academic year 2024-25:
Fullbright Specialist Opportunity:
You can request the collaboration of U.S. faculty members who are part of the Fullbright Specialist roster for periods of 2-6 weeks, engaging in teaching and consultancy activities. The deadline for applications is December 15, 2023. For more information, visit
this page
.
Fullbright Intercountry Opportunity:
If you are interested in hosting U.S. Fullbright faculty and researchers in Italy and Europe for the academic year 2023-24 to conduct lectures, seminars, and participate in conferences, this opportunity has no specific deadline. Find out more on
this page
.
SUSI Competition (Study of the US Institutes for Student Leaders):
Open to undergraduate students in their first or second year (Italian citizens or with residency permits), this program focuses on Civic Engagement at the Michigan State University. It offers a summer opportunity (5 weeks between June and August) with full expenses covered by the Department of State. The application deadline is November 19. Learn more on
this page
.
Additionally, there are ongoing competitions for study, research, and teaching for the academic year 2024-25. You can find all the information on
this page
.
